definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
flower/earlobe/fig. item on both sides/classifier for flowers, clouds etc

sentences.english: None of them thought of looking at the ricks.
sentences.chinese: 他们谁也没想到要看麦垛一眼。

sentences.english: He placed the chopped wood orderly on the woodstack.
sentences.chinese: 劈好的干柴整齐地码在柴垛上。

sentences.english: Dongsheng walks towards the jackstraw pile at the field corner.
sentences.chinese: 冬生往田角的稻草垛走去。

sentences.english: Every time she discharged a small stack of fodders from the full wicker basket.
sentences.chinese: 每一趟都从满满的柳篮卸下一小垛草料。

sentences.english: Google Duo is an attempt to fix this gap, letting users chat across platforms.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌垛是试图来弥补这一差距，跨平台让用户聊天。

sentences.english: There have reports of worm casts being deposited to such a height in cereal stooks.
sentences.chinese: 据报道，蚯蚓的粪可堆至谷垛的高度。

definition: rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc
branches of a tree/fork of a tree
to build a structure out of layered bricks or stones
to build by laying bricks or stones
